Diplomatic: Padjer ayns gaelic

Manx: jeh dy chooilley vyghin,
English: Father of all mercies,
Diplomatic: Ayr jeh dy chooilley vighyn.

Manx: Çhiarn Niau as thalloo,
English: Lord of Heaven and Earth,
Diplomatic: Chiarn Niau as thalloo

Manx: Cur dy Spyrryd ayns my chree
English: Put your Spirit in my heart,
Diplomatic: cur dy Spyrrys ayns my chree

Manx: Dy ynsagh mee dy chur enney ort
English: And teach me to recognise you
Diplomatic: dy ynsagh mee dy cur enney ort

Manx: As dy cur graih dhyt, dy voddym çheet lesh dunnalys
English: And to love you so that I may come with courage,
Diplomatic: as dy cur graih dhyt dy voddym cheet lesh dunnalys

Manx: Gys stoyl reeoil Dty graase flaunysagh.
English: To the royal seat of heavenly grace,
Diplomatic: gys stoal reeoil dy graase flaunysagh

Manx: Dy voddym cosney myghyn as graase dy cooney lhiam
English: That I may gain mercy and grace to help me
Diplomatic: Dy voddym costney myghyn as graase dy cooney lhiam

Manx: Ayns dy chooilley hraa dy feme.
English: In every time of need.
Diplomatic: ayns dy chooilley chra dy feme

Manx: Niee my annym ayns fuill Chreest
English: Wash my soul in the blood of Christ
Diplomatic: Nhiee my annym ayns fuill Chreest

Manx: Ta glenney voish dy chooilley peccah.
English: That cleans away every sin.
Diplomatic: ta glenney voish dy chooilley peccah,

Manx: O, gow jee’m ooilley ny fritlagyn loau jeh my ynrickys hene,
English: O, take from me all the rotten rags of my own righteousness,
Diplomatic: O gow jee’m ooilley ny fritlagyn loau jeh my ynricys hene,

Manx: As coamree mee lesh yn gharmad aalin jeh ynrikys Chreest.
English: And clothe me with the beautiful garment of Christ’s righteousness.
Diplomatic: As coamree mee lesh yn garmad aalin jeh ynrikys Chreest

Manx: Ta mee goaill rish dy vel mee cretoor peccoil
English: I accept that I am a sinful creature,
Diplomatic: Ta mee ghoaill rish, dy vel mee cretoor peccoil

Manx: Ny-yeih T’ou er ghra rooin ayns Dty ghoo
English: Nevertheless, you have said to us in your Word
Diplomatic: ny-yeih T’ou er gra roon ayns dy goo

Manx: My nee mayd goaill rish nyn beccaghyn
English: That if we admit our sins
Diplomatic: my nee mayd ghoaill rish nyn beccaghyn

Manx: Dy vel Uss firrinagh as cairagh
English: That you are true and just,
Diplomatic: Dy vel Uss firrinagh as cairagh,

Manx: Dy leih dooin nyn beccaghyn
English: To forgive us our sins
Diplomatic: dy lieh doon nyn beccaghyn

Manx: As dy ghlenney shin voish dy chooilley neuynrickys.
English: And to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
Diplomatic: as dy ghlenney shin voish dy chooilley neuynrickys,

Manx: O, Hiarn jean mish y yannoo my cretoor noa ayns Christ,
English: O Lord make me a new creature in Christ
Diplomatic: O Hiarn jean mish y yannoo my cretoor noa ayns Christ

Manx: Son my saillt foddee Oo mish y yannoo glen
English: For if it pleases you, you may make me clean,
Diplomatic: son my saiylt foddee Oo mish y yannoo glen

Manx: As T’ou er ghra ayns yn ghoo dy irriney,
English: And you have said in the Word of truth,
Diplomatic: as tow er ghra ayns yn goo dy irriney,

Manx: Quoi erbee nee geamagh er ennym yn Çhiarn
English: Whoever calls on the name of the Lord,
Diplomatic: Quoi erbee nee geamagh er ennym yn Chiarn

Manx: Dy bee eh er ny hauail.
English: That he will be saved.
Diplomatic: dy bee eh er ny hauail.

Manx: Nish O my Hiarn, saue mish,
English: Now, O, my Lord, save me,
Diplomatic: Nish O my Hiarn, saue mish,

Manx: Voish pooar as deyrey peccah
English: From and the power and condemnation of sin
Diplomatic: voish pooar as deyrey peccah

Manx: As skeayl yn graih ayd ayns my chree,
English: And spread your love in my heart,
Diplomatic: as skeayle yn ghraih ayd ayns my chree.

Manx: Dy voddym ve graihagh ort,
English: That I may love you
Diplomatic: Dy voddym ve graihagh ort,

Manx: Erskyn dy chooilley nhee,
English: Above all things,
Diplomatic: erskin dy chooilley nhee

Manx: As cummal gys Dty chrosh.
English: And hold to the cross.
Diplomatic: as cummal gys dy chrosh

Manx: O Haualtagh Bannit, soilshee Oo hene dou
English: O Blessed Saviour, reveal yourself  to me
Diplomatic: O Haualtagh Bannyt, soiljee Oo hene dow

Manx: Er yn aght nagh vel Oo soilshagh Oo hene da’n seihll.
English: In the way you don’t reveal yourself to the world.
Diplomatic: er yn aght nagh vel Oo soiljagh Oo hene da’n seihll

Manx: Niartee my credjue as cum seose mee
English: Strengthen my faith and uphold me
Diplomatic: Niartee my credjue as cum seose mee

Manx: As bee’m ayns saueçhys
English: And I will be in safety
Diplomatic: as bee’m ayns saueshys

Manx: Son cha vod unnane mee y ghoaill ass shen.
English: For no one can take me out of there.
Diplomatic: son cha vod unnane mee y ghoaill as shen.

Manx: Ynsee dou dy yannoo Dty aigney
English: Teach me to do your will
Diplomatic: Ynsee dow dy yannoo dy aigney

Manx: Dy voddym gaase ayns graase, as tushtey,
English: So that I may grow in grace, and knowledge,
Diplomatic: dy voddym gaase ayns graase, as tushtey,

Manx: jeh my Hiarn Yeesey Chreest.
English: of my Lord Jesus Christ.
Diplomatic: jeh my Hiarn Yeesey Chreest.

Manx: Croo aynym cree glen, O, Yee,
English: Create within me a pure heart O God,
Diplomatic: Chroo aynym chree glen O Yee

Manx: As jean Oo yn noa spyrryd cairagh (???)
English: And make the new spirit righteous (???)
Diplomatic: as jean oo yn noa spyrryd cairagh

Manx: Er çheu shtie jee’m.
English: Within me.
Diplomatic: er cheau stie jee’m

Manx: Gow mee myr ta mee
English: Take me as I am,
Diplomatic: gow mee mor ta mee

Manx: As jean rhym myr t’ou fakin mie.
English: And do unto me as you see fit.
Diplomatic: as jean rym mor t’ou fakin mie,

Manx: Bee my chemmyrk as my endeilagh,
English: Be my shelter and defender,
Diplomatic: be my kimmyrk as my endeealagh,

Manx: Choud as ta mee ayns yn faasagh shoh.
English: For as long as I am in this wilderness.
Diplomatic: choud as ta mee ayns yn faasagh shoh.

Manx: As jean mee aarloo son yn ynnyd-vaghee
English: And make me ready for that dwelling place
Diplomatic: As jean mee aarloo son yn ennyd veaghee

Manx: Shen T’ou er gholl dy chiartaghey
English: You will be getting ready
Diplomatic: shen tou er gholl dy chartaghey

Manx: Dausyn ta graihagh Ort,
English: For those who love You,
Diplomatic: dausyn ta graihagh ort.

Manx: Dy voddym kiauleeaght marish ny nooghyn
English: So that I may sing with the saints,
Diplomatic: dy voddym chiauleeagh marish ny nooghyn

Manx: Ta ersooyl thie gys nyn cummalyn syn aer
English: That are away home to their dwellings in the sky,
Diplomatic: ta ersooyl thie gys nyn coamalyn syn aer

Manx: Er son Dty ghraih yindyssagh ayns choyrt Oo hene
English: For the wonderful love in which You gave Yourself
Diplomatic: er son dy ghraih yindesagh ayns churt Oo hene

Manx: Son oural son cloan Adam
English: As a sacrifice for the children of Adam
Diplomatic: son oural son chloan Adam

Manx: As dy ren Oo surranse baase er yn chrosh er nyn son
English: And suffered death on the cross for us
Diplomatic: as dy ren Oo surrans baase er yn chrosh er nyn son

Manx: Tra va shin marroo ayns peccah, fegooish Jee,
English: When we were dead in sin; godless,
Diplomatic: tra va shin marroo ayns peccah, fegoish Jee,

Manx: As fegooish triesht ayns yn seihll.
English: And without a hope in the world.
Diplomatic: as fegoish triesht ayns yn seihll.

Manx: Ren oo yn shee ain rish Jee liorish deayrtey Dty uill
English: You made our peace with God by spilling your blood
Diplomatic: Ren oo yn shee ain reish Jee liorish dheartey dy uill

Manx: Son cloan sheelnaue, as gymmyrkey nyn beccaghyn
English: For the children of man and bearing our sins
Diplomatic: son chloan shelnaue as gymmyrkey ny beccaghyn

Manx: Ayns Dty chorp hene er yn villey.
English: In your own body upon the tree.
Diplomatic: ayns dy chorp hene er yn villey

Manx: O, Yee cur grayse dou dy ve ynrican bio Dhyt hene
English: O, God, give me grace to be only alive for you
Diplomatic: O yee cur graase dow dy ve ynrican bio dhyt hene

Manx: Chouds ta mee ayns shoh wass,
English: Whilst I am here below,
Diplomatic: chouds ta mee ayns shoh wass

Manx: Dy voddym shooyl ayns Chreest;
English: That I may walk in Christ
Diplomatic: Dy voddym shooyl ayns Chreest yn raaid

Manx: Yn raad, yn irryn as yn vea,
English: The way, the truth and the life,
Diplomatic: yn irryn as yn vea

Manx: Gys nee oo fakin eh mie dy ghoaill mee ersooyl
English: Until you see it fit to take me away
Diplomatic: gys nee oo fakin eh mie dy ghoaill me ersooyl

Manx: Veih seihll dy voirey as anvea,
English: From a world of sorrow and discord,
Diplomatic: veih seihll dy voirrey as anvea,

Manx: Gys yn fea shen va keayrt cour Dty phobble hene,
English: To that rest that once was for your own people,
Diplomatic: gys yn fea shen ta keayrt cour dy phobble hene,

Manx: As gwee dy bee ooilley adsyn ta faggys as deyr dou,
English: And beseeching that all those that are near and dear to me,
Diplomatic: as ghohl dy bee ooilley, adsyn ta faghys as deyr dow,

Manx: Er ny hauail trooid Chreest
English: Be saved through Christ
Diplomatic: er ny hauail trooid Chreest

Manx: Dy vod mayd ooilley meeiteil
English: That we may all meet
Diplomatic: dy vod mayd ooilley meeitteil

Manx: Ec Dty laue yesh as seyr voish pian.
English: At the right hand and free from pain.
Diplomatic: ec dy laue yesh as seyr voish pian

Manx: Cur glooyr da Jee,
English: Glory to God,
Diplomatic: chur glooyr da Jee.

Manx: Er coontey toilçhynys nyn Jiarn Yeesey Chreest.
English: On account of the merits of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Diplomatic: Er coontey tolchynys nyn Jiarn Yeesey Chreest
